Key Arguments: The legislation could allow future governments to subjectively define misinformation and disinformation based on political or social agendas.
The bill threatens fundamental democratic values, including free expression and privacy rights.
There is potential for misuse, allowing governments to suppress criticism by labeling it as misinformation without recourse.
Notable Quotes: I had not seen such an unacceptable piece of legislation which has the potential to strike at the heart of the fundamental values of democracy in a free Australia.
This Bill fails to respect the sanctity of free expression and associated rights to privacy and has the potential for misuse and to be completely undemocratic.
